content: I have a layout with a few blocks, and one of them needs to be removed due to not being used currently. However, in the hope it'll be used again in future, I don't want to remove it completely. So I'm wondering if there's a way of disabling blocks, like how we can disable menu items...?

There's a feature request for it: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/1936

[UX] Layout UI: Allow blocks to be disabled/hidden instead of removed. 路 Issue #1936 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
This was the initial goal of #1776 as filed by @Graham-72: Is there a way I could suspend publication of a block i.e. unpublish it as one can for a node? I have a small block that provides a specia...

...and @docwilmot has provided https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/block_disabler

backdrop-contrib/block_disabler
Allows admins to hide blocks without removing from the layout. - backdrop-contrib/block_disabler
